source.name: _java._heap_size
source.label: Heap size
source.description: Specify the maximum Java Virtual Machine heap size in megabytes.

source.name: byte_limit
source.label: Byte limit
source.description: The maximum number of bytes to return. Use any of these suffixes; KB, MB, GB, or TB

source.name: date_format
source.label: Date format
source.description: The format of date values, for example, yyyy-[m]m-[d]d

source.name: decimal_format
source.label: Decimal format
source.description: The format of decimal values, for example, #,###.##

source.name: decimal_format_decimal_separator
source.label: Decimal separator
source.description: The character used to separate the integer part from the fractional part of a number. This property and decimal grouping separator property must be unique. If you encounter error related to them not being unique when only one of them was provided then please provide the missing one explicitly.

source.name: decimal_format_grouping_separator
source.label: Decimal grouping separator
source.description: The character used to group digits of similar significance. This property and decimal separator property must be unique. If you encounter error related to them not being unique when only one of them was provided then please provide the missing one explicitly.

source.name: display_value_labels
source.label: Display value labels
source.description: Display the value labels

source.name: encoding
source.label: Encoding
source.description: The appropriate character encoding for your data, for example, UTF-8

source.name: encryption_key
source.label: Encryption key
source.description: Key to decrypt sav file

source.name: escape_character
source.label: Escape character
source.description: The character that's used to escape other characters, for example, a backslash. Escaping is a string technique that identifies characters as being part of a string value.

source.name: escape_character_value
source.label: Escape character value
source.description: The custom character that is used to escape other characters.

source.name: exclude_missing_values
source.label: Exclude missing values
source.description: Set values that have been defined as missing values to null

source.name: field_delimiter
source.label: Field delimiter
source.description: The character that separates each value from the next value, for example, a comma

source.name: field_delimiter_value
source.label: Field delimiter value
source.description: The custom character that separates each value from the next value

source.name: file_format
source.label: File format
source.description: The format of the file

source.name: file_name
source.label: File name
source.description: The name of the file to read

source.name: first_line
source.label: First line
source.description: The first line of data or header

source.name: first_line_header
source.label: First line is header
source.description: The first line of the file contains column headers

source.name: infer_as_varchar
source.label: Infer as VARCHAR
source.description: Treat the data in all columns as VARCHARs

source.name: infer_record_count
source.label: Infer record count
source.description: The number of records to process to obtain the structure of the data

source.name: infer_schema
source.label: Infer schema
source.description: Obtain the schema from the file

source.name: infer_timestamp_as_date
source.label: Infer TIMESTAMP as DATE
source.description: Infer columns containing date and time data as date

source.name: invalid_data_handling
source.label: Invalid data handling
source.description: How to handle values that are not valid: fail the job, null the column, or drop the row

source.name: json_infer_record_count
source.label: Infer record count
source.description: Deprecated. Use infer_record_count property. The number of JSON elements to process to obtain the structure of the data

source.name: json_path
source.label: JSON path
source.description: The path that identifies the elements to retrieve from a JSON document, for example, /book/publisher

source.name: labels_as_names
source.label: Labels as names
source.description: Set column names to the value of the column label

source.name: null_value
source.label: Null value
source.description: The value that represents null (a missing value) in the file, for example, NULL

source.name: partition_name_prefix
source.label: Partition name prefix
source.description: The prefix in each partition name

source.name: quote_character
source.label: Quote character
source.description: The character that's used to enclose string values, for example, a double quotation mark

source.name: range
source.label: Cell range
source.description: The range of cells to retrieve from the Excel worksheet, for example, C1:F10

source.name: read_mode
source.label: Read mode
source.description: The method for reading files

source.name: row_delimiter
source.label: Row delimiter
source.description: The character or characters that separate one line from another, for example, CR/LF (Carriage Return/Line Feed)

source.name: row_limit
source.label: Row limit
source.description: The maximum number of rows to return

source.name: sheet_name
source.label: Worksheet name
source.description: The name of the Excel worksheet to read from

source.name: time_format
source.label: Time format
source.description: The format of time values, for example, HH:mm:ss[.f]

source.name: timestamp_format
source.label: Timestamp format
source.description: The format of timestamp values, for example, yyyy-MM-dd H:m:s

source.name: type_mapping
source.label: Type mapping
source.description: Overrides the data types of specified columns in the file's inferred schema, for example, inferredType1:newType1;inferredType2:newType2

source.name: use_field_formats
source.label: Use field formats
source.description: Format data using specified field formats

source.name: use_variable_formats
source.label: Use variable formats
source.description: Format data using specified variable formats.

source.name: xml_path
source.label: XPath
source.description: The path that identifies the root elements to retrieve from a XML document, for example, /book/publisher

source.name: xml_path_fields
source.label: Fields XPath
source.description: The path that identifies the specified elements to retrieve from the root path of a XML document, for example, ../publisher

source.name: xml_schema
source.label: Schema of XML
source.description: The schema that specified metadata information of elements, for example, data type, values, min, max
